Class BufferedPlot

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Canvas
              |
              +--BufferedPlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class BufferedPlot
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.awt.event.ComponentListener

A BufferedPlot maintains an off-screen drawing surface that reacts to resize events. Clients that wish to draw to the surface register as BufferedPlotListeners. Clients are notified when the dimensions of the drawing surface change. Clients are also told when to draw to the surface.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

BufferedPlot

public BufferedPlot()
Constuct a new BufferedPlot. It will resize the off-screen drawing surface when placed into a Container, as well as when that Container resizes.
Method Detail

add_client

public void add_client(BufferedPlotListener client)
Register a BufferedPlotListener.
Parameters:
client - the client to receive events from the instance of this class

public void remove_client(BufferedPlotListener client)
Remove the given BufferedPlotListener.
Parameters:
client - the client to remove from the list of clients to receive events

update

public void update(java.awt.Graphics g)
Update the on-screen surface. Initialize the off-screen surface if necessary, clear it with white, tell the clients to render to it, then draw it on-screen.
Overrides:
update in class java.awt.Component

set_graphic_size

public void set_graphic_size(java.awt.Dimension dim)
Explicitly set the size of the off-screen surface. Note: the class always responds to resize events.
Parameters:
dim - desired dimensions of the offscreen graphic
